intro: Eriostemon fitzgeraldii, commonly known as the Fitzgerald's eriostemon, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often covered in fine hairs. It is an important component of the local flora and supports various pollinators.
